name: Cauliflower Alfredo Spinach Artichoke Lasagna. Vegan Nut-free Recipe
description: This Vegan Cauliflower Alfredo Lasagna is filled with Spinach, Artichokes, alfredo sauce, veggies and is a perfect main. Easy Creamy Cauliflower alfredo Sauce Recipe. Vegan Soy-free Nut-free. Makes 1 9 by 9 square lasagna pan.
recipeIngredient: 3  loaded cups cauliflower florets (1.5 to 2 inch pieces)
3/4 cup non dairy milk (I used almond milk)
1/4 tsp dry basil or a Tbsp fresh basil leaves
a very generous dash of black pepper
1 Tbsp flour of choice (omit to make gluten-free)
5 to 6  artichokes (finely chopped (I used canned, drain, rinse and use))
No boil Lasagna noodles as needed

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add oil and heat at medium heat. Add chopped garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the cauliflower, water and salt and cover and cook for 10 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Cool slightly, add everything including water to a blender and blend with non dairy milk, all the spices, oil, and flour. Blend to a smooth puree. Taste and adjust salt, herbs and tang if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add oil and heat at medium heat. Add chopped garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the cauliflower, water and salt and cover and cook for 10 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Cool slightly, add everything including water to a blender and blend with non dairy milk, all the spices, oil, and flour. Blend to a smooth puree. Taste and adjust salt, herbs and tang if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: Layer 3/4 -1 cup pasta sauce in the baking pan, then layer noodles. Add more sauce to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Layer 3/4 -1 cup pasta sauce in the baking pan, then layer noodles. Add more sauce to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Then layer fresh baby spinach or use frozen(thawed), then 3/4 to 1 cup alfredo sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Then layer fresh baby spinach or use frozen(thawed), then 3/4 to 1 cup alfredo sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Add another layer of noodles, then pasta sauce, then add veggies of choice like mushrooms, bell peppers, zucchini, cooked lentils or veggie burger crumbles. then layer noodles, alfredo sauce , distribute chopped artichoke hearts on the sauce. Sprinkle pepita parmesan (or nutritional yeast) on the artichoke hearts.
recipeInstructions.name: Add another layer of noodles, then pasta sauce, then add veggies of choice like mushrooms, bell peppers, zucchini, cooked lentils or veggie burger crumbles. then layer noodles, alfredo sauce , distribute chopped artichoke hearts on the sauce. Sprinkle pepita parmesan (or nutritional yeast) on the artichoke hearts.

recipeInstructions.text: Add a layer of noodles. add a 1/3 cup water all around the edges. then a good 1-1.5 cups pasta sauce on the top layer to seal all the layers. Drizzle some alfredo sauce on the pasta sauce and add pepita parm and a spray of oil. Sprinkle a generous sprinkle of salt and black pepper and italian herb blend. I also added some pepper flakes. Add vegan cheese shreds if you like.
recipeInstructions.name: Add a layer of noodles. add a 1/3 cup water all around the edges. then a good 1-1.5 cups pasta sauce on the top layer to seal all the layers. Drizzle some alfredo sauce on the pasta sauce and add pepita parm and a spray of oil. Sprinkle a generous sprinkle of salt and black pepper and italian herb blend. I also added some pepper flakes. Add vegan cheese shreds if you like.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover with foil, punch a few small holes and bake at 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 45 to 50 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover with foil, punch a few small holes and bake at 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 45 to 50 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool slightly, slice and serve hot.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool slightly, slice and serve hot.
